results.name: Thebes
results.endText: The largest city of the ancient region of Boeotia and was the leader of the Boeotian confederacy. A major rival to Athens and Sparta.

results.name: Athens
results.endText: A center for the arts, learning and philosophy. A powerful city-state protected only by a wooden wall.

results.name: Sparta
results.endText: Unique in ancient Greece for its social system and constitution. A society with all social institutions focused on military training and physical development.

cards.title: Power and influence
cards.content: Thebes was shrewd and used it's central location to influence all of Greece

cards.title: Strong walls and a network of vassal states
cards.content: While Thebes relied on control of it's neighbors to exert power it was also protected by strong fortifications

cards.title: Isolation. Walls may protect from siege but vassals protect from invasion
cards.content: Thebes was centrally located and used control over neighboring villages and cities to protect itself

cards.title: Knowledge and wisdom
cards.content: Athens was a hub for philosohpy and science

cards.title: A citizen army and a professional navy
cards.content: Athens used silver from local mines to pay a professional navy.

cards.title: Tyrants and the mob, each a different but equal threat
cards.content: athens was a democracy but prone to domination by aristocrats or overrule in times of panic.

cards.title: Perfect martial prowess.
cards.content: Sparta was a brutal society that trained citizen men for one thing, war.

cards.title: Every man, a warrior.
cards.content: Spartans only raised citizen sons born without defect and dedicated their lives to training. However they maintained strong diplomacy to deploy their warriors only when necessary.

cards.title: A slave uprising, while warriors are in battle far away who keeps the homeland safe?
cards.content: All Spartan citizen men being warriors meant they relied upon slave labor for food and manufacture.
